results.title: Glimpses of ‘Lost Tribe’ Jewish Communities in India and Myanmar
results.abstract: Often overlooked, the communities in South and Southeast Asia complicate notions of Jewish identity while emphasizing its malleability.

multimedia.caption: Yonahan Khaim, the chazzan, or prayer leader, of the Talpiyot Synagogue in Kalay, Mayanmar, celebrates Havdalah, the set of blessings that ends the Jewish Sabbath. Like many other other members of the Talpiyot Synagogue, Mr. Khaim was born Christian and converted to Judaism when he was an adult.

results.title: Health experts voice support for opening booster access to older and at-risk Americans.

multimedia.caption: A man receiving his third dose of the Pfizer-BioNTech Covid vaccine in Southfield, Mich., in the days after federal regulators approved offering the shots to people whose immune systems are compromised to bring their levels of protection into a more normal range. Booster shots, by contrast, are intended to counter any waning of the protections of full vaccination.

results.title: First Tied to ISIS, Then to U.S.: Family in Drone Strike Is Tarnished Twice

results.title: In Senegal, Demand for Covid Vaccines Grows, but They’re Hard to Get
results.abstract: As rumors and misinformation about coronavirus vaccines gradually subside and the West African country emerges from a third wave, Senegalese are less reluctant to take a shot.
results.byline: By Mady Camara and Ruth Maclean

multimedia.caption: A patient receiving her second dose of the AstraZeneca vaccine at a hospital in the Ngor neighborhood of Dakar, Senegal.

results.title: Despite Censorship and Poor Internet, Cuban Podcasts Are Booming
results.abstract: New audio shows made in Cuba are finding a rapt audience and upending the island’s hyperpartisan media landscape.
org_facet: Empresa de Telecomunicaciones de Cuba SA (Etecsa)

results.title: The Covid Crisis Is Now a Garbage Crisis, Too
results.abstract: Overblown fears that the coronavirus could be transmitted through surfaces have created a stigma around handling nonhazardous trash, experts say. Some recyclable waste has been junked or burned.

multimedia.caption: Workers sorted medical waste outside a hospital treating Covid-19 patients in Veracruz, Mexico, last year.

results.title: The Scientist and the A.I.-Assisted, Remote-Control Killing Machine
results.abstract: Israeli agents had wanted to kill Iran’s top nuclear scientist for years. Then they came up with a way to do it with no operatives present.
results.byline: By Ronen Bergman and Farnaz Fassihi

multimedia.caption: Mohsen Fakhrizadeh, the father of Iran’s nuclear program, kept a low profile, and photographs of him were rare. This photo appeared on martyrdom posters after his death.
multimedia.copyright: Arash Khamooshi for The New York Times
